text:
Top destinations for a spooky weekend getaway this Halloween Published on : Tuesday, October 13, 2015
Tap into your inner child and scare yourself silly this Halloween by visiting destinations inspired by your favorite horror movies and TV shows. With October 31st falling on a Saturday this year, priceline.com, a leader in online and mobile travel, has compiled top destinations for a spooky weekend getaway, from which include haunted houses, ghost tours and other fright-inducing activities.
“Halloween is a great time to take a spur-of-the-moment getaway since hotel rates tend to drop for the fall shoulder season,” said priceline.com Travel Analyst Brian Ek. “Regardless of the destination you choose, the priceline.com app can get you there on the go with plenty of hotel, airfare and rental car deals that are far from scary.
For the most bang for your buck, Ek recommends giving priceline.com’s Express Deals a try. Travelers can snag hotels in locations central to the festivities and do so at a bargain.
Priceline.com’s 7 Spookiest Halloween Weekend Getaways
1. Sleepy Hollow, NY
The real-life Sleepy Hollow, near the Tappan Zee Bridge, is a must-see for more literary Halloween and Washington Irving fans. Philipsburg Manor transforms its grounds into Horseman’s Hollow filled with vampires, witches and the Headless Horseman himself. Take a lantern tour of Sleepy Hollow Cemetery to see Irving’s grave and enter the crypt of notorious vampire Barnabas Collins. For tamer fare, listen to the reading of The Legend of Sleepy Hollow at the Old Dutch Church.
Watch Before You Go
“Sleepy Hollow” TV series on Fox
“Sleepy Hollow” movie
Disney’s “The Legend of Sleepy Hollow”
Sample Hotel Express Deals
Tarrytown/Elmsford/Hawthorne – 3.5-stars, $110/night, includes free parking, free Wi-Fi, fitness center and pool.
Rye/White Plains – 3.5-stars, $107/night, includes pool and fitness center.
2. Universal’s Halloween Horror Nights in Orlando and Hollywood
Hollywood’s top animators, make-up artists and scare specialists have created a live collection of haunted houses, special “scare zones” and shows featuring characters from “The Walking Dead,” “Freddy vs. Jason,” “Insidious,” and more. For those with multiple Halloween activities to attend, Horror Nights is open on select dates from Sept. 18 to Nov. 1.
Watch Before You Go
“Freddy vs. Jason” movie
“The Walking Dead” TV show
“Insidious” and “The Purge” movies
Sample Hotel Express Deals
Orlando: International Drive/Convention Center/Pointe Orlando Area – 4 stars, $66/night, includes pool, fitness center and onsite restaurant.
Hollywood: Beverly Hills/Century City – 4 stars, $192/night, includes free Wi-Fi, pool, and is pet friendly.
3. Salem, MA
Salem might win the title of Halloween-Town USA. After all, it is home to the infamous witch hysteria and subsequent hanging of 19 women on Gallows Hill. Visitors can enter the Witch Dungeon to see a re-enactment of a witch trial. In the evening, check out the guided, candle-light Witch Trial Trail, or take the Salem Witch Walk. Tour the House of Seven Gables, the subject of Nathaniel Hawthorne’s book, and don’t miss the several balls that Salem throws around the special holiday – just be sure to reserve tickets early.
Watch Before You Go
“Hocus Pocus” movie
“The Crucible” movie
Sample Hotel Express Deals
Bedford/Burlington – 3.5 stars, $74/night, includes free parking, pool, and fitness center.
Woburn/Wakefield – 3.5 stars, $129/night, includes free parking, pool, and fitness center.
4. New Orleans, LA
Next to Mardi Gras, Halloween is New Orleans’ biggest celebration with parades, street parties and more. Voodoo tradition permeates The Big Easy, from the French Quarter to its cemeteries, also known as “cities of the dead”. Be sure to stop in at the Voodoo Museum on Dumaine Street first for some protective potions. The French Quarter offers many walking ghost tours, and the Voodoo Music Festival runs Oct. 30 to Nov. 1, with headliners like Ozzy Osbourne, Girl Talk, and DeadMau5.
Watch Before You Go
“Interviews With A Vampire: The Vampire Chronicles” movie
“The Skeleton Key” movie
Sample Hotel Express Deals
Convention Center/Warehouse Arts district– 3 stars, $315/night, includes free Wi-Fi, free breakfast, pool, and fitness center.
Downtown – 4.5 stars, $358, includes pool, fitness center, and is pet friendly.
5. Gettysburg, PA
Site of one of the bloodiest battles in the American Civil War, paranormal experts claim that long-dead soldiers and civilians still walk the fields and local houses. Book a candle-lit ghost walk on the battlefield. At the historic Farnsworth House, visitors can participate in a séance and conjure up spirits. Locals say Gettysburg is the most haunted patch of ground in America, so there’s no shortage of options for amateur paranormal investigators looking for a ghost sighting.
Watch Before You Go
“Gettysburg” movie
Sample Hotel Express Deals
Gettysburg Area – 3.5 stars, $122/night, includes free Wi-Fi, pool, fitness center, and is pet friendly.
Chambersburg Area – 2.5 stars, $62/night, includes free parking, free Wi-Fi, free breakfast, pool, fitness center, and is pet friendly.
6. Savannah, GA
Savannah has a rich ghost and pirate history. At the Sorrel-Weed House, visitors can rent paranormal-activity measuring gear and participate in a Halloween night ghost hunt in the mansion, or take the Savannah Ghosts and Ghouls walking tour. Have dinner at The Pirates House, where legend says unwary visitors were smuggled through a secret passageway to waiting ships, where they became unwilling seamen.
Watch Before You Go
“Midnight In The Garden of Good and Evil” movie
Sample Hotel Express Deals
Savannah Historic District – 4 stars, $137/night, includes free Wi-Fi, pool and fitness center.
7. Winchester Mystery House, San Jose, CA
The Winchester Mystery House is full of staircases that lead nowhere, doors that open to large drop-offs, and secret passageways. While mourning the death of her husband and child, Sarah Winchester is said to have built the odd home in order to confuse the ghosts that trailed in her wake. On select evenings this October and November, visitors can attend a very special “open house” for the mansion and its “residents,” touring the myriad of rooms and passageways with only the moonlight and a flashlight to guide them.
Watch Before You Go
“Haunting of Winchester House” movie
